Package com.lucaf.robotic_core.dhRobotics.sacN

Class SACN

java.lang.Object
com.lucaf.robotic_core.impl.MotorInterface
com.lucaf.robotic_core.dhRobotics.sacN.SACN
public class SACN extends MotorInterface
Class representing a SAC_N motor controller device.

  • Constructor Details

    • SACN

      public SACN(RegisterInterface registerInterface, HashMap<String,Object> state, State notifyStateChange)
      Primary constructor that initializes the SAC_N instance with an existing register interface and a pre-existing state map. It also allows registering a notification callback for state changes.
      Parameters:
      registerInterface - low-level interface used to read/write registers
      state - shared map containing the device state
      notifyStateChange - optional callback that will be notified on state changes

    • SACN

      public SACN(RegisterInterface registerInterface, HashMap<String,Object> state)
      Constructor that initializes the instance with a register interface and a state map. The notification callback is not set.
      Parameters:
      registerInterface - low-level interface used to read/write registers
      state - shared map containing the device state

    • SACN

      public SACN(RegisterInterface registerInterface)
      Constructor that initializes the instance only with the register interface. A new empty state map is created internally.
      Parameters:
      registerInterface - low-level interface used to read/write registers

  • Method Details

    • applyConfiguration

      public void applyConfiguration(SACNConfig configuration) throws IOException
      Apply the provided SACNConfig configuration to the device by setting acceleration and maximum speed.
      Parameters:
      configuration - the SACNConfig object containing desired parameters
      Throws:
      IOException - if communication with the device fails

    • applyActuatorParameters

      public void applyActuatorParameters(ActuatorParameters parameters) throws IOException
      Apply the provided actuator parameters (acceleration and speed) to the device by writing the appropriate registers.
      Parameters:
      parameters - the ActuatorParameters object containing desired values
      Throws:
      IOException - if communication with the device fails

    • stop

      public void stop() throws IOException
      Immediately stops device movement and updates internal flags. This call also sends the stop command to the device by writing the start/stop register.
      Overrides:
      stop in class MotorInterface
      Throws:
      IOException - if communication with the device fails while sending the command

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown() throws IOException
      Perform a controlled shutdown of internal resources (executors) and stop the device. It cancels scheduled tasks and sets the device into shutdown state.
      Overrides:
      shutdown in class MotorInterface
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the shutdown procedure

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed(int speed) throws IOException
      Write the desired movement speed into the device register.
      Parameters:
      speed - movement speed (units and range depend on the device)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register write fails

    • getSpeed

      public int getSpeed() throws IOException
      Read the currently set speed from the device.
      Returns:
      the speed read from the device register
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register read fails

    • setAcceleration

      public void setAcceleration(int velocity) throws IOException
      Write the desired acceleration into the device register.
      Parameters:
      velocity - desired acceleration (units depend on the device)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register write fails

    • getAcceleration

      public int getAcceleration() throws IOException
      Read the configured acceleration from the device.
      Returns:
      the acceleration read from the device register
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register read fails

    • setEnabled

      public void setEnabled(boolean enabled) throws IOException
      Enable or disable the device by writing the appropriate register.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable, false to disable
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register write fails

    • isEnabled

      public boolean isEnabled() throws IOException
      Check whether the device is currently enabled by reading the status register.
      Returns:
      true if the device is enabled, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register read fails

    • isArrived

      public boolean isArrived() throws IOException
      Check whether the device has reached the target position by reading the motion feedback state.
      Returns:
      true if the motion has arrived at the target, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register read fails

    • getStatus

      public Status getStatus() throws IOException
      Retrieve the current status of the device as a Status object.
      Returns:
      an instance of Status containing current status flags
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register read fails

    • isHome

      public int isHome() throws IOException
      Read the code that indicates the "home" (initialization/reference) state.
      Returns:
      numeric code representing the home state
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register read fails

    • hasInitialized

      public boolean hasInitialized() throws IOException
      Check if the device has completed initialization (homing).
      Returns:
      true if the device is back to "home" position, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register read fails

    • waitReachedPosition

      public void waitReachedPosition(long timeout) throws IOException
      Synchronously wait until the device reaches the target position. The method checks for timeout, device faults and movement state.
      Parameters:
      timeout - maximum time in milliseconds to wait; if <=0 waits indefinitely
      Throws:
      IOException - if a timeout occurs, the device is in fault or the movement was stopped

    • waitReachedPosition

      public void waitReachedPosition() throws IOException
      No-timeout variant of waitReachedPosition(long) that waits indefinitely.
      Throws:
      IOException - in case of error or interruption

    • initialize

      public Future<Boolean> initialize() throws RejectedExecutionException
      Initialize the device by running the homing routine and enabling error checks. Initialization is performed in a separate thread and returns a Future that signals the success of the operation.
      Overrides:
      initialize in class MotorInterface
      Returns:
      Future returning true if initialization succeeded, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RejectedExecutionException - if the task cannot be submitted to the executor

    • moveAbsolutePosition

      public void moveAbsolutePosition(int position) throws IOException
      Set absolute target position by writing the dedicated register.
      Parameters:
      position - absolute target position (device units)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register write fails

    • moveRelativePosition

      public void moveRelativePosition(int position) throws IOException
      Perform a relative move from the current position by writing the appropriate register.
      Parameters:
      position - relative displacement to apply (positive or negative depending on direction)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register write fails

    • clearErrors

      public void clearErrors() throws IOException
      Clear motor faults by sending the clear fault command to the device.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register write fails

    • moveAbsolutePositionAndWait

      public Future<Boolean> moveAbsolutePositionAndWait(int position)
      Move the device to the specified absolute position and wait for completion. The operation runs in a separate thread; the Future returns true if the movement succeeds.
      Parameters:
      position - absolute target position
      Returns:
      Future returning true if the movement completed successfully, false on error

    • moveRelativePositionAndWait

      public Future<Boolean> moveRelativePositionAndWait(int position)
      Move the device by a relative displacement and wait for completion. The operation runs in a separate thread; the Future returns true if the movement succeeds.
      Parameters:
      position - relative displacement
      Returns:
      Future returning true if the movement completed successfully, false on error

    • getErrors

      public ErrorFlags getErrors() throws IOException
      Read error codes from the device and construct an ErrorFlags instance.
      Returns:
      an ErrorFlags object containing error flags/description
      Throws:
      IOException - if the register read fails
